intro: [WRONG START] Cressa crectica var. indica, commonly known as Indian cress, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
